Job Posting:169397 - Position: F25 Global Procurement, Developer, Intern (8 Months) 169397 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2025 - Fall App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 05/25/2025 11:59 PM Through Employer Website 05/08/2025 09:31 AM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Country RBC (Royal Bank of Canada) Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode 2025 - Fall F25 Global Procurement, Developer, Intern (8 Months) 169397 Co-op Position Toronto, ON Canada 8 months To be confirmed Salary Currency CAD Salary Job Description Job Summary Salary Not Available, 0 Major List Are you interested in an exciting opportunity at RBC as a Developer for 8 Months? You will work closely with the Product and Technical teams to scale the existing capability of RBC's employee expense technology platform (SAP Concur). For this role we are looking for an individual to assist in driving process improvements by developing an MVP for integrating with RBC Enterprise solutions. Job Description What will you do? • Design, develop, and test an MVP for the Concur Product Team. • Use technologies (e.g., Python, JavaScript, GitHub, etc.) to build a proof of concept/prototype. • Develop RESTful APIs and web services to support integrations with enterprise platforms. • Collaborate with business users and senior leaders to gather requirements and brainstorm solutions. • Create and review technical design documents, understand how the design will be used in the code development process, and facilitate meetings to design, troubleshoot, and execute projects. Participate in system integration, data mapping, and testing activities to ensure seamless integration. • What's in it for you? We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual. At RBC, you will have opportunities to: • Interact with leaders who support your development through coaching and managing • Network and build lasting relationships with students from diverse backgrounds from across Canada • Make a difference and lasting impact through meaningful work • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team We encourage you to apply as soon as possible as we accept applications on a rolling basis, but please note that the formal application deadline is May 26, 2025. Should you be selected to progress, someone from our team will reach out directly to provide instructions on next steps. Otherwise, feel free to check for progress updates by logging in to your RBC profile. If the status has not changed, it denotes the fact that your application is still under review. RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. The successful candidate for this role will be required to be located within Ontario for the duration of the work term. Details regarding the specific virtual, hybrid, and in-office arrangements for this Integrated Learning/ Co-op position are to be discussed with the Hiring Manager. Job Skills Agile Product Development, Communication, Computer Literacy, Data Mining, Detail-Oriented, Interpersonal Relationships, Listening Effectively, Personal Development, Personal Initiative, RESTful APIs, Web APIs Job Requirements What do you need to succeed? Must-have • Currently enrolled in a Computer Science or Engineering bachelor's degree. • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written). Team player with a strong desire to collaborate to generate solutions. Creative and analytical thinker who is self-driven and capable of working in a fast-paced environment. • • Nice-to-have • Understanding of web technologies and frameworks (e.g., React, Node.js, Flask, Django). • Familiarity with RESTful APIs, webhooks, and microservices architecture. Basic knowledge of database platforms (e.g., SQL, MongoDB) is an asset. • This posting is for a 8-months Fall 2025 student placement with a start date of September 2025 and end date of April 2026. In order to be eligible for these student positions, you must either: • Be returning back to school after the work term end-date (April 24, 2026); or • If you are not returning back to school (i.e. are graduating immediately after the work term), you must require the full work term as a mandatory component in order to graduate successfully Please ensure that you meet these eligibility requirements before applying - candidates who apply but are found to be ineligible are not able to be considered. Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Application Links: https://jobs.rbc.com/ca/en/job/RBCAA0088R0000124762EXTERNALENCA/2025-Fall-Global-Procurement-Developer-Intern-8- Months Application Deadline: 2025-05-27 Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the day prior to the application deadline date above Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
